thread.title: SNP business rates cap is not enough to save firms argue Tories | UK | News | Express.co.uk
thread.title_full: SNP business rates cap is not enough to save firms argue Tories | UK | News | Express.co.uk

author: Tom Martin
title: SNP business rates cap is not enough to save firms argue Tories | UK | News | Express.co.uk
text: GETTY Thousands of Scottish firms might not benefit from Derek Mackay's cap Mr Mackay's £44.6 million reprieve came after weeks of insisting the SNP administration was already doing enough to help despite warnings of soaring prices, closures, and job losses. We need to see meaningful action from the SNP if we are to avoid seeing these businesses going to the wall Murdo Fraser, Scottish Tory finance spokesman He was also accused of trying to pass the buck to councils, claiming they could provide relief if they wished. Scottish Tory finance spokesman Murdo Fraser said: “For weeks the SNP ignored the issue of business rates, and now it turns out that their proposed plan will only help a fraction of businesses. PH Scottish Tory SMPs criticised the SNP for ignoring the issue of business rates “Around Scotland businesses are facing closure if they don’t receive real help from the Scottish Government, but these figures show that the vast majority will still not receive any assistance. “We need to see meaningful action from the SNP if we are to avoid seeing these businesses going to the wall, and it’s becoming clear that the SNP need to go back to the drawing board on this plan.” Sturgeon's top moments
